document.heading: UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AMENDMENT ACT OF 2003

history.narrative: Law 15-171, the “Unemployment Compensation and Domestic Violence Amendment Act of 2004”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 15-436, which was referred to Committee of Public Service. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 2, 2004, and April 6, 2004, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 21, 2004, it was assigned Act No. 15-418 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 15-171 became effective on June 19, 2004.
